question: How does it feel to be a woman in STEM?
answer: It feels awesome! I hope I am motivating some of you to become interested in these fields.

question: Have you made any games?
answer: Yes I have made a few simple games!

question: Which University do you recommend?
answer: A university that gives you the opportunity to work on real world projects. I love all of the UC schools. However, the most important thing here is to attend a university :)

question: How many languages do you know?
answer: Two languages: English and Spanish.

question: Have you ever been to Egypt?
answer: Not yet, but hoping to visit within the next 5 years!

question: Can you hack games?
answer: I cannot hack games.

question: Can you give me any tips on coding because I am interested and in a coding class now?
answer: That's exciting! A few tips: 1) Ask for help when you get stuck 2) Be patient. It can be hard in the beginning 3) Don't give up 4) Have fun!

question: How many countries have you been to?
answer: I have been to 11 countries so far!

question: Which college did you go to?
answer: University of California, Merced. Go Bobcats!

question: Where is your favorite place to travel so far?
answer: That is a tought question! I will have to choose London because there is always so much to do there and I used to visit there alot when I lived in Europe.

question: How long have you been in your career field?
answer: A little over 4 years now!

question: Tips for coding?
answer: A few tips: 1) Ask for help when you get stuck 2) Be patient. It can be hard in the beginning 3) Don't give up 4) Have fun!

question: Do you know of any coding challenges for me to do?
answer: Yes below are a few good places to code!

question: Do you work with a lot of other women in the STEM field?
answer: I work with very few women in this field. I encourage women to give this field a chance. It is a very exciting place to be in my opinion!

question: What are your favorite animals?
answer: DOGS! WOOF WOOF!

question: Is coding hard to learn?
answer: In my opinion, coding can be hard. It takes alot of effort and practice, but it is also very fun an provides many job opportunities.

question: Do you know chemistry and physics?
answer: Yes I do!

question: Out of all the places you’ve been, what’s your favorite?
answer: It is too hard for me to choose one! So I'll choose two. 1) Barcelona: beautiful city, amazing food, and wonderful people. 2) London: So much to see and do!

question: Who is your favorite basketball player? Team?
answer: Stephen Curry and the Golden State Warrios. GO WARRIORS!

question: Do you like your job? PS I know Mr. Goolsby (LOL)?
answer: I am enjoying my current job. Mr. Goolsby is the best!

question: Do you like to run?
answer: Love to run!

question: Do you like to have fun? (LOL)
answer: I love to have fun!

question: Any tips for being successful in college?
answer: The number one tip is to not be afraid to fail. Even if a project is hard, you should still give it your best to finish a project. The most important thing you can do is try.

question: Where do you like to hike?
answer: I like to hike where there are waterfalls or hikes near the ocean!

question: What is your greatest record in running?
answer: My fastest half marathon (13.1 miles) time was 1 hour and 56 minutes.

question: How did you get into computer programming and why do you like it?
answer: I had my first computer programming class in college because it was part of the engineering course and I fell in love. I always loved technology so it is so much fun being able to combine science and technology.

question: What is the key to getting to where you are now?
answer: I think being kind, helping others, and working hard has helped me to getting where I am now.
